dt: {bc}to bring to mind or think of again
{bc}to keep in mind for attention or consideration

dt.t: {wi}remember{/wi} the facts until the test is over

dt: {bc}to exercise or have the power of memory

pt: {sc}remember{/sc} {sc}recollect{/sc} {sc}recall{/sc} {sc}remind{/sc} {sc}reminisce{/sc} mean to bring an image or idea from the past into the mind. {sc}remember{/sc} implies a keeping in memory that may be effortless or unwilled.

pt.t: {it}remembers{/it} that day as though it were yesterday

pt: {sc}recollect{/sc} implies a bringing back to mind what is lost or scattered.
{sc}recall{/sc} suggests an effort to bring back to mind and often to re-create in speech.

pt.t: can't {it}recall{/it} the words of the song

pt: {sc}remind{/sc} suggests a jogging of one's memory by an association or similarity.
{sc}reminisce{/sc} implies a casual often nostalgic recalling of experiences long past and gone.

et: Middle English {it}remembren{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}remembrer{/it}, from Late Latin {it}rememorari{/it}, from Latin {it}re-{/it} + Late Latin {it}memorari{/it} to be mindful of, from Latin {it}memor{/it} mindful {ma}{mat|memory|}{/ma}
shortdef: to bring to mind or think of again

dt: used to ask someone to give greetings to another person

dt.t: {it}Remember me to{/it} your aunt when you see her today.

shortdef: —used to ask someone to give greetings to another person

meta.id: for as long as one can remember
stems: for as long as one can remember

hwi.hw: for as long as one can remember

dt: {bc}for most or all of one's life {bc}for a very long time

dt.t: Her family has lived in New York {it}for as long as she can remember{/it}.

shortdef: for most or all of one's life : for a very long time
